string.name: title_schedule
string.translation_description: The title for the schedule screen where user can see their schedule for the Android Dev Summit.

string.name: title_info
string.translation_description: The title for the info screen where user can see various information, such as FAQ and travel info.

string.name: title_agenda
string.translation_description: The title for the agenda screen where user can see all the sessions they plan to attend.

string.name: filters
string.translation_description: The label for the button to filter sessions by their topics, room, and so on.

string.name: category_heading_tracks
string.translation_description: Label in the filters panel above session topics (Android, Cloud, etc.)

string.name: category_heading_types
string.translation_description: Label in the filters panel above event types (Sessions, Codelabs, etc.)

string.name: clear_all
string.translation_description: The label for the button to clear all the filter conditions.

string.name: reset
string.translation_description: The label for the button to reset the filter conditions.

string.name: pinned_events_filter_description
string.translation_description: Message shown when the user toggles the switch to see their pinned events.

plurals.name: filter_event_count
plurals.translation_description: A label showing how many events match the current filters

string.name: search_schedule_hint
string.translation_description: Text field hint that is shown when user has not entered a search query

string.name: search_schedule_no_results
string.translation_description: Text that is shown if there are no search results

string.name: event_starred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user adds an event to their schedule.

resources.string: Event added to your starred items

string.name: event_unstarred
string.translation_description: The message shown when user removes an event from their schedule.

string.name: event_star_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user tries to add an event.

resources.string: Error adding event to starred items

string.name: reservation_error
string.translation_description: The message shown for an error when user is trying to reserve a session attendance.

resources.string: Error making changes to reservation. Wait for previous requests to finish or try again later.

string.name: reservation_request_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user tries to reserve a seat for a session.

string.name: reservation_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation for a session.

string.name: reservation_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is confirmed by the system.

resources.string: Your seat has been reserved for \"%s\".

string.name: reservation_replaced
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has chosen to replace a reservation for another and it is confirmed by the system.

string.name: waitlist_new
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is added to the waitlist of a session reservation.

string.name: waitlist_cancel_succeeded
string.translation_description: The message shown when user has canceled their reservation and was waitlisted for a session.

string.name: got_it
string.translation_description: The label for dismissing a information messages.

string.name: dont_show
string.translation_description: The label for opting out of in-app notification messages.

string.name: reservation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Reservation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: reservation_denied_clash
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because they have reserved another event at that time

resources.string: Reservation denied: clash with another reservation

string.name: reservation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user's reservation is denied because of an unknown error

string.name: cancellation_denied_cutoff
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because the session starts too soon

resources.string: Cancellation denied: too close to start time.

string.name: cancellation_denied_unknown
string.translation_description: The message shown when user is trying to cancel a reservation but it's denied because of an unknown error

string.name: schedule_filters_empty
string.translation_description: The message shown when a schedule page is empty because no events match the current filters.

resources.string: No events today match your current filters.

string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user can request to reserve a seat.

string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which the user cannot request a seat.

string.name: reservation_pending
string.translation_description: Label shown on events for which a reservation request is pending.

string.name: travel_directions_description
string.translation_description: Instructions on how to find directions to the conference.

string.name: travel_shuttle_description
string.translation_description: Shuttle service instructions.

resources.string:
TODO: Shuttles will be provided from the Mountain View Caltrain station to the Computer History Museum in the morning and from the Computer History Museum to the Mountain View Caltrain station in the evening.

Morning Shuttles will run every 15 minutes from 7:00am-10:00am.

Evening Shuttles will run every 15 minutes from 6:00pm-11:00pm.

string.name: travel_carpool_parking_description
string.translation_description: Carpool and parking instructions.

resources.string:
TODO:There are a limited number of parking spaces available at the Computer History Museum. However, overflow parking will be available on a first-come first-served basis.

Bike parking is complimentary for attendees and will be available outside of the venue during event hours. Please note that there is only enough parking for 10 bicycles. Parking will be on a first-come, first-served basis.

string.name: travel_public_transportation_description
string.translation_description: Public transportation instructions.

resources.string:
TODO: Downtown Mountain View Station

600 W Evelyn Ave, Mountain View, CA 94041. See schedule for current departure and arrival times.

string.name: travel_childcare
string.translation_description: Mother's room and childcare instructions

resources.string: Please ask a member of staff at the registration or help desk for the location of each room onsite. We will be offering reimbursement for childcare for those attendees that may require it. To find out more information please email android-dev-summit@google.com.

string.name: attending_sessions_description
string.translation_description: Attending sessions instructions

resources.string: All presentations will be in English. Attendance at sessions and product demos is on a first-come, first-served basis.

string.name: badges_description
string.translation_description: Badges instructions

resources.string:
Badge pickup will be available starting at TODO. Make sure to bring your photo ID along with your registration confirmation email, as we’ll need to verify it prior to assigning you your badge for this event. We’re OK with government issued licenses, passports, and other forms of identification. If you don’t have proper identification, you won’t be able to receive a badge and won’t be admitted into the conference. Everyone is guaranteed a seat for the keynotes but the best seats will be assigned on a first- come, first-served basis. So make sure to arrive to the event on the earlier side!

Please note, you may not share, give, or otherwise provide your event badge to anyone. Badges aren’t replaceable, so don’t lose yours or you won’t be readmitted to the conference. You must wear your badge to gain admission to this event, including the sessions, codelabs, and after hours. If requested by security, please display or provide additional identification. Badges may include your name and company or organization (if provided).

TODO Google strives to make events open and accessible to everyone, regardless of disability or special needs. Participants with disabilities and/or special needs should provide details in the registration form and/or by emailing us at android-dev-summit@google.com. This information will be kept private and will be distributed only to the individuals who need to know it to complete accommodation requests. Otherwise, please ask a member of staff at the help desk for assistance or questions about accessibility during the event.

Attendees must be at least 15 years of age to attend Android Dev Summit 2019 unaccompanied. Although 15-, 16- and 17-year-old attendees don’t require an adult to accompany them, they must return a signed parental consent form in advance of the event. Google does not offer chaperone tickets for 15-, 16- and 17-year-old attendees. Please contact android-dev-summit@google.com for more details.

Attendees younger than 15 years of age require parent or legal guardian to a company them to attend Android Dev Summit 2019. The parent or legal guardian of the minor attendee must return a signed parental consent form in advance of the event. Please contact android-dev-summit@google.com for more details.

The event will be held indoors. It’s a developer event with no enforced dress code, so please be comfortable and casual. There will be a free coat check available near registration for your convenience.
Please ask a member of staff at the registration or help desk for the location of the Prayer room.
No solicitation or selling of items or services is allowed at this event. Any attendee conducting these activities might be removed from the event.

string.name: event_sessions_description
string.translation_description: General information on sessions

resources.string: Sessions are a chance to learn about Android’s newest technologies directly from Android engineers and leadership. Here you’ll see presentations and demos on our latest features and updates from the staff who helped build them.

string.name: event_sandbox_description
string.translation_description: General information on sandboxes.

resources.string: Dedicated spaces to explore, learn, and play with our latest products and platforms via interactive demos, physical installations, and more.

string.name: event_codelabs_description
string.translation_description: General information on codelabs.

resources.string: Google Developers Codelabs provide a guided, tutorial, hands-on coding experience by stepping you through the process of building a small application, or adding a new feature to an existing application.

string.name: event_lightning_description
string.translation_description: General information on Lightning talks.

resources.string: A lightning talk is very short and focused presentation that lasts only a few minutes, using a format that introduces urgency. This style of micro presentation allows many speakers to present in a single session at a forum, thereby quickly transferring information and avoiding “death by powerpoint” at conferences.

string.name: event_afterhours_description
string.translation_description: General information on after hours.

resources.string: All registered attendees are invited to the after party on the evening of TODO. Event credentials will be required for entry. Please join us for appetizers, drinks, music, games, and more. Alcoholic beverages will be available for those 21 years of age and over.

string.name: event_officehours_description
string.translation_description: General information on office hours and app reviews.

resources.string: Office Hour Pods are your chance to meet one-on-one with Android experts to ask all your technical questions! Here, you’ll have an opportunity to receive advice and tips on your specific app-related projects.

string.name: event_fireside_description
string.translation_description: General information on Fireside chats.

resources.string: A fireside chat is an information discussion between a moderator and one or more Android professionals in front of an audience. Although there won’t be a fire to sit beside, the conversational tone of the chat typically evokes an easy and relaxed language that promotes examples and analogies for better understanding. The audience is often invited to ask questions or make remarks either during or after the chat.

string.name: event_meals_description
string.translation_description: General information on meals.

resources.string: Attendees are offered complimentary breakfast, lunch, and snacks on the day of the conference.
